noun.description: A moral or legal obligation; a responsibility.
examples: it's my duty to uphold the law
she was determined to do her duty as a citizen

noun.description: A task or action that someone is required to perform.
examples: your duties will include sweeping the switchboard

noun.description: A payment levied on the import, export, manufacture, or sale of goods.
The measure of an engine's effectiveness in units of work done per unit of fuel.

phrases: her mug was doing duty as a wine glass
Anecdote dominates many chapters, with unreflective reportage frequently doing duty for examination.
My new paint tubes are arranged in a neat arc, brushes and palette knife by their side, and an upturned white enamel plate ready to do duty as a palette until I can find an old one or buy new.
Swear words are interwoven throughout military slang, doing duty for most parts of speech.
Okay, Saturn is usually black and I suppose soldering wire might do duty as lead thread.
origin: Late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French duete, from Old French deu (see due).
